<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Lot of Nebraska content up here these days, but I must begin the newsletter by wishing a happy 91st birthday to Warren Buffett. One of my favorite Buffett quotes is: "It's far better to buy a wonderful company at a fair price than a fair company at a wonderful price" because it applies to so much more than investing (and helps justify a recent AirPods purchase).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Neal Freyman</em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WEATHER
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/powerfull-hurricane-ida-makes-landfall-louisiana?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New Orleans Goes Dark
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NOAA hurricane map" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDM4L25vYWEucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>NOAA</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hurricane Ida <a href="https://apnews.com/article/hurricane-ida-115ff1a54e18d9eee61a81afa8df9fad?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slammed</a> into Louisiana on exactly the same date, Aug. 29, as Katrina did in 2005. Ida made landfall as a Category 4 hurricane with 150 mph sustained winds, slightly more powerful than Katrina’s Category 3. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The entire city of New Orleans was left without power, according to the regional energy provider Entergy. As of late last night, the only power to the city was coming from generators.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick rewind: </strong>In addition to killing more than 1,800 people, Katrina caused more than $100 billion in property damage, mainly due to the storm surge overwhelming the levees that were built to hold it back. A $14.6 billion risk-reduction plan was put in place after Katrina in order to contain those surges.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The economic impact</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While we don’t know how the new flood prevention measures held up as of this morning, we do know that Ida struck a crucial energy infrastructure hub along the New Orleans-Baton Rouge corridor. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Louisiana’s refineries make up almost 20% of the country’s total refining capacity.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And 60% of gasoline used on the East Coast comes from Gulf Coast refineries.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So basically where Ida is striking is “the just absolute <a href="https://apnews.com/article/hurricane-ida-katrina-compare-louisiana-88dce72660d0c928f4815eff5a8bfd8f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worst place</a> for a hurricane,” Weather Underground founder Jeff Masters told the AP. If refineries suffer a direct hit, gas prices <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/28/oil-firms-cut-us-gulf-of-mexico-output-by-91percent-ahead-of-hurricane-ida.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could rise</a> by about 10 cents in many East Coast markets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Along with its threat to energy infrastructure, Ida also presents a logistical challenge for the Louisiana hospitals treating more than 2,400 Covid-19 patients statewide. Without electricity, hospitals will need to rely on generators to keep life-saving ventilators running. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>this is the beginning, not the end, of the Ida story. “There is no doubt that the coming days and weeks are going to be extremely difficult for our state and many, many people are going to be tested in ways that we can only imagine,” LA Gov. John Bel Edwards said yesterday.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F08%2F30%2Fpowerfull-hurricane-ida-makes-landfall-louisiana" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/oxygen-runs-short-supply-covid19-patients-water-treatment-space-missions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Got Oxygen?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/oxygen-runs-short-supply-covid19-patients-water-treatment-space-missions?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Oxygen tank" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDM5L294eWdlbl90YW5rLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mufid Majnun on Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As if the Southeast US didn’t have enough to deal with already, hospitals are running low on oxygen for treating Covid-19 patients, and it’s causing ripple effects for other industries that use the stuff for their daily operations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The number of people hospitalized in the US with Covid-19 has <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-covid-19-hospitalizations-approach-a-peak-as-delta-variant-spreads-11630155627?mod=hp_lead_pos6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">exceeded 100,000</a> for only the second time in the pandemic. Because Covid attacks the respiratory system, patients with severe cases often require highly concentrated oxygen to help them breathe.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But diverting oxygen to hospitals to treat Covid-19 patients means it can’t be deployed for other uses. Uses like...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Water treatment: </strong>Earlier this month, Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer asked residents to <a href="https://www.wesh.com/article/orlando-mayor-to-hold-newser-on-unprecedented-event-requiring-community-assistance/37359831?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hold off</a> on activities like power washing the deck in order to conserve water. Liquid oxygen is used to treat the water supply, but the city is running low because of the crush of Covid hospitalizations.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Florida’s Hillsborough County (home to Tampa) said last week that residents might notice a </span><span><a href="https://www.wfla.com/news/hillsborough-county/tampa-bay-water-changes-water-treatment-process-due-to-liquid-oxygen-shortage/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">change</a></span><span> in the smell or taste of their drinking water, since the water utility needed to switch up its treatment process due to the lack of oxygen.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Space: </strong>Turns out, to get to a place where there’s very little oxygen, you need a lot of it as a propellant for rockets. On Friday, NASA <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-28/spacex-ula-see-launch-risk-from-low-oxygen-supply-amid-pandemic?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delayed</a> the September launch of an earth-surveillance satellite because of the Covid-induced oxygen shortage. Other launches across the industry may be pushed back, too. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At a space conference last week, SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell said, “We certainly are going to make sure the hospitals are going to have the oxygen that they need” for Covid patients. But if anyone has some liquid oxygen lying around their basement, “Send me an email."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>It wouldn’t be a 2021 business story without a supply chain angle. Health officials say a shortage of truck drivers with the specialized skills to transport oxygen is compounding the problem. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/rent-prices-surging?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
High Rents Are Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/rent-prices-surging?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='A "for rent" sign appears in front of a row of townhomes.' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82Mzg1L2Zvcl9yZW50X2hvdXNpbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The No. 1 comeback story of the year isn’t jeans—it’s rental prices.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the first half of the year prices have increased more than 11%, well above the broader inflation rate. Now, rent prices in 87 of the country’s 100 largest cities have fully returned to pre-pandemic levels. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The website Apartment List <a href="https://www.apartmentlist.com/research/whats-driving-up-rent-prices-this-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> some of the trends behind the trend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Moving out: </strong></span><span>During the beginning of the pandemic, young renters left the big city to hole up with their parents. Now, after one too many times being asked to empty the dishwasher, they're looking for their own places.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Buying a house is too expensive: </strong></span><span>Skyrocketing housing prices are causing some would-be homeowners to choose renting instead.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A sense of urgency: </strong></span><span>People aren’t browsing Zillow to pass a slow day at work—they want to rent </span><span><em>right now</em></span><span>, crowding the market with high-intent customers.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">There isn’t enough housing available, </strong></span><span>which, of course, drives up prices.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“When it’s all said and done, 2021 will go down as a year when housing affordability went from bad to <a href="https://twitter.com/robnock_/status/1431313701898915840?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">really bad</a>, especially in mid-sized markets,” per Apartment List’s Rob Warnock. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/30/key-performance-indicators-august-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Cargo ships waiting to get into the port of Long Beach " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDQwL2NhcmdvX3NoaXBzX3dhaXRpbmdfdG9fZ2V0X2ludG9fdGhlX3BvcnRfb2ZfbG9uZ19iZWFjaC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.marinetraffic.com/en/ais/home/centerx:-118.2/centery:33.7/zoom:11" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">MarineTraffic</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The only thing worse than LA road traffic is LA marine traffic. 44 container ships were <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-28/u-s-port-problems-reach-worst-of-pandemic-amid-crush-of-imports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">waiting for a berth</a> at the twin ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach on Friday—the highest number since the pandemic began. Supply chains remain discombobulated as US retailers rush to bring in goods from Asia ahead of the holiday shopping season. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“You’re going to see [marketing] to the scale of what we’ve seen in the past with Viagra and Humira.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Be prepared to get <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/7e1c9afc-b7c8-4368-b590-6171f53a2895?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slammed</a> with Covid-19 vaccine commercials while watching football this season, UNC marketing professor Markus Saba told the Financial Times. Pfizer is hiring a new salesforce to push its vaccine, which accounted for about a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/pfizer-reports-35-billion-q1-earnings-thanks-covid-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quarter</a> of the company’s total revenue in Q1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The economic case for bringing in as many refugees as possible. (<a href="https://www.vox.com/22634047/afghanistan-refugees-tucker-carlson-housing-economy?stream=future" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a>)</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Holmes trial: </strong>With all due respect to the ISM manufacturing report, the business story everyone will be talking about this week is the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/28/22646130/theranos-elizabeth-holmes-sunny-balwani-abuse-fraud?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criminal fraud trial </a>of Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of disgraced blood-testing startup Theranos. Jury selection begins tomorrow.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Jobs report: </strong>A <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/fed-gov-waller-strong-august-jobs-report-will-be-green-light-for-taper-202340105.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strong August jobs report</a> on Friday (>850,000 jobs added) could perhaps spur the Fed to begin tapering its bond purchases sooner than planned. Economists polled by Dow Jones think we’ll come in just under that, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/27/a-key-jobs-report-in-the-week-ahead-could-drive-the-next-big-market-move.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">at 750,000</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>There are fewer stars reporting this week than competing at the US Open, but we should mention several nonetheless: Zoom, Chewy, DocuSign, and...yeah that’s it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>September begins on Wednesday</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bonnaroo is on Thursday</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Get pumped for the long Labor Day weekend</span></li>
</ul>

670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNOAA\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHurricane Ida \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/hurricane-ida-115ff1a54e18d9eee61a81afa8df9fad?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslammed\u003c/a\u003e into Louisiana on exactly the same date, Aug. 29, as Katrina did in 2005. Ida made landfall as a Category 4 hurricane with 150 mph sustained winds, slightly more powerful than Katrina’s Category 3. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe entire city of New Orleans was left without power, according to the regional energy provider Entergy. As of late last night, the only power to the city was coming from generators.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eQuick rewind: \u003c/strong\u003eIn addition to killing more than 1,800 people, Katrina caused more than $100 billion in property damage, mainly due to the storm surge overwhelming the levees that were built to hold it back. A $14.6 billion risk-reduction plan was put in place after Katrina in order to contain those surges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe economic impact\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile we don’t know how the new flood prevention measures held up as of this morning, we do know that Ida struck a crucial energy infrastructure hub along the New Orleans-Baton Rouge corridor. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLouisiana’s refineries make up almost 20% of the country’s total refining capacity.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd 60% of gasoline used on the East Coast comes from Gulf Coast refineries.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo basically where Ida is striking is “the just absolute \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/hurricane-ida-katrina-compare-louisiana-88dce72660d0c928f4815eff5a8bfd8f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworst place\u003c/a\u003e for a hurricane,” Weather Underground founder Jeff Masters told the AP. If refineries suffer a direct hit, gas prices \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/28/oil-firms-cut-us-gulf-of-mexico-output-by-91percent-ahead-of-hurricane-ida.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould rise\u003c/a\u003e by about 10 cents in many East Coast markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlong with its threat to energy infrastructure, Ida also presents a logistical challenge for the Louisiana hospitals treating more than 2,400 Covid-19 patients statewide. Without electricity, hospitals will need to rely on generators to keep life-saving ventilators running. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethis is the beginning, not the end, of the Ida story. “There is no doubt that the coming days and weeks are going to be extremely difficult for our state and many, many people are going to be tested in ways that we can only imagine,” LA Gov. John Bel Edwards said yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Oxygen?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Oxygen tank\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82NDM5L294eWdlbl90YW5rLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMufid Majnun on Unsplash\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs if the Southeast US didn’t have enough to deal with already, hospitals are running low on oxygen for treating Covid-19 patients, and it’s causing ripple effects for other industries that use the stuff for their daily operations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe number of people hospitalized in the US with Covid-19 has \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-covid-19-hospitalizations-approach-a-peak-as-delta-variant-spreads-11630155627?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexceeded 100,000\u003c/a\u003e for only the second time in the pandemic. Because Covid attacks the respiratory system, patients with severe cases often require highly concentrated oxygen to help them breathe.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut diverting oxygen to hospitals to treat Covid-19 patients means it can’t be deployed for other uses. Uses like...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWater treatment: \u003c/strong\u003eEarlier this month, Orlando Mayor Buddy Dyer asked residents to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wesh.com/article/orlando-mayor-to-hold-newser-on-unprecedented-event-requiring-community-assistance/37359831?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehold off\u003c/a\u003e on activities like power washing the deck in order to conserve water. Liquid oxygen is used to treat the water supply, but the city is running low because of the crush of Covid hospitalizations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eFlorida’s Hillsborough County (home to Tampa) said last week that residents might notice a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wfla.com/news/hillsborough-county/tampa-bay-water-changes-water-treatment-process-due-to-liquid-oxygen-shortage/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echange\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in the smell or taste of their drinking water, since the water utility needed to switch up its treatment process due to the lack of oxygen.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpace: \u003c/strong\u003eTurns out, to get to a place where there’s very little oxygen, you need a lot of it as a propellant for rockets. On Friday, NASA \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-08-28/spacex-ula-see-launch-risk-from-low-oxygen-supply-amid-pandemic?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edelayed\u003c/a\u003e the September launch of an earth-surveillance satellite because of the Covid-induced oxygen shortage. Other launches across the industry may be pushed back, too. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAt a space conference last week, SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell said, “We certainly are going to make sure the hospitals are going to have the oxygen that they need” for Covid patients. But if anyone has some liquid oxygen lying around their basement, “Send me an email.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIt wouldn’t be a 2021 business story without a supply chain angle. Health officials say a shortage of truck drivers with the specialized skills to transport oxygen is compounding the problem. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe No. 1 comeback story of the year isn’t jeans—it’s rental prices.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the first half of the year prices have increased more than 11%, well above the broader inflation rate. Now, rent prices in 87 of the country’s 100 largest cities have fully returned to pre-pandemic levels. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe website Apartment List \u003ca href=\"https://www.apartmentlist.com/research/whats-driving-up-rent-prices-this-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e some of the trends behind the trend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMoving out: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDuring the beginning of the pandemic, young renters left the big city to hole up with their parents. Now, after one too many times being asked to empty the dishwasher, they're looking for their own places.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBuying a house is too expensive: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSkyrocketing housing prices are causing some would-be homeowners to choose renting instead.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA sense of urgency: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePeople aren’t browsing Zillow to pass a slow day at work—they want to rent \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eright now\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, crowding the market with high-intent customers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere isn’t enough housing available, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewhich, of course, drives up prices.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“When it’s all said and done, 2021 will go down as a year when housing affordability went from bad to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/robnock_/status/1431313701898915840?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereally bad\u003c/a\u003e, especially in mid-sized markets,” per Apartment List’s Rob Warnock. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
